message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

This paper deals with the asymptotic behavior of polar codes, which are a type of error-correcting codes used in communication systems. The paper uses information theory concepts such as channel capacity and Bhattacharyya process, which suggests that it belongs to the cs.IT (Information Theory) sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves analyzing the performance of polar codes under different decoding algorithms, which could fall under the cs.CC (Computational Complexity) sub-category. The paper also uses probabilistic analysis and statistics, which could place it in the cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) sub-category. The paper deals with large blocklengths and asymptotic behavior, which could suggest it belongs to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves analyzing the scaling behavior of error probabilities, which could place it in the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category.
